result.title: Partial Pattern Search
result.content:
Hi, Codeforces

I'm struggling to find a way to do partial search pattern in a string. Let's define a string s within you need to search for a pattern p. You need to find start_index and end_index of p in s. There should be only one or zero occurrences of that pattern in string. String s can have any character as well as p.

Examples:

s = "hey wtf hello h are you", p = "hello h are you" -> Solution: start_index = 8, end_index = 22

s = "hey wtf hello h are you", p = "helloh are you" -> Solution: start_index = 8, end_index = 22

s = "hey wtf (hello h are you)", p = "helloh are you" -> Solution: start_index = 9, end_index = 23

s = "hey wtf hello [h] are you??? ! hehe", p = "hello[h] are you" -> Solution: start_index = 8, end_index = 25

So even if there is difference between some words within pattern and string, it should find it. Real case is where you have parsed pdf content with two differenet tools, it will differ between spaces and other \W characters, but visualy they will be the same (words will be the same, maybe some will be fused because of new line, new page etc). And your task is to get part of the page from one of the pdf contents and to search that text in the other pdf content within the same page, and it should find it.

Thanks.
